name: The Assassination of Lincoln Quiz | U.S. Presidents | 10 Questions

options: Murder key members of the Cabinet
questions.explanation:
Kidnap Lincoln.

	The original idea was to kidnap Lincoln. It didn't work out - then, Lee surrendered. The idea of killing Lincoln - and others - came later.

questions.text: Who accompanied Lincoln to the theatre on the night that he was shot?
questions.explanation:
Mrs. Lincoln

	His wife was seated beside him when the shot was fired.

questions.text: What play was Lincoln watching at Ford's Theatre on the night of the assassination?
questions.explanation:
Our American Cousin.

	A light comedy, starring Laura Keene.

questions.text: What did Booth yell when he leaped onto the stage after shooting the president?
questions.explanation:
Sic semper tyrannis.

	The Latin phrase means "thus always to tyrants", and is also the state motto of Virginia. 'Useless, useless' were Booth's last words after he was shot; he is believed to have been referring to his hands as he lay dying on the Garrett family porch.

questions.text: What injury did Booth suffer during the assassination-and-flight?
questions.correct: Broke a bone when he jumped onto the stage
options: Suffered a knife wound while struggling to escape the theatre after the shooting
Thrown by his horse while fleeing
questions.explanation:
Broke a bone when he jumped onto the stage.

	Booth broke a bone in his leg when he jumped onto the stage. Previously, he inflicted (but did not receive) a knife wound on a soldier who tried to restrain him after the shooting.

questions.text: Who was the doctor that treated Booth's injury after the shooting of the president?
questions.explanation:
Dr. Mudd

	Dr. Samuel Mudd treated Booth - and paid a dear price for doing so. How much did he know about the shooting - or about the identity of his injured patient? No one knows.

questions.text: What kind of trial did the other conspirators receive?
questions.explanation:
Military Trial.

	Trial by military tribunal.

questions.text: Which of the conspirators was a woman?
questions.explanation:
Surratt.

	Mary Surratt was one of the "conspirators"; she may have received a raw deal. Her son, John, may have been more involved, but he was able to escape capture.

questions.text: Every crime has a punishment. What happened to the conspirators Mrs Surratt, Herold, Powell, and Atzerodt?
questions.explanation:
Hanged.

	Mrs Surratt was the first woman to be hanged by the US Government. A number of other conspirators were sentenced to imprisonment.

questions.text: It now appears fairly certain that Booth:
questions.correct: Was involved in espionage for the Confederacy
questions.explanation:
Was involved in espionage for the Confederacy.

	Booth may well have been a spy for the Confederacy.
